intro: Sida oligandra, commonly known as the narrowleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a shrub or herbaceous plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 centimeters. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped. Sida oligandra is adapted to grow in a variety of soil types, including sandy and clay soils, and it thrives in full sun. It is often found in disturbed areas, along roadsides, and in open woodlands.
